result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:40 AM Defendant ISABELLA G HANNEMAN in court.  Attorney Matthew Goldin by video for the defendant. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Goldin confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA makes bond recommendation. Atty Goldin makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court notes he knows the defendant's parents but doesn't believe he needs to recuse himself. The parties have two weeks to file something if they wish the Court to recuse himself from this case. Court will set for Status of Prelim November 29, 2022 at 10:00 AM

Court adjourned at 9:43 AM.
